feed.title: SCD News
feed.tagline: Crohn's Disease, Ulcerative Colitis, Specific Carbohydrate Diet, SCD, IBD, and IBS News blog. Breaking the vicious cycle!

link.title: SCD News

info.div: This is an Atom formatted XML site feed. It is intended to be viewed in a Newsreader or syndicated to another site. Please visit the Blogger Knowledge Base for more info.

Get your Plans for SCD off th...

SCD COOKING CLASS
Get your Plans for SCD off th...

entry.title:
SCD COOKING CLASS
Get your Plans for SCD off th...

summary.div:
SCD COOKING CLASS
Get your Plans for SCD off the Back Burner And START COOKING!
You are invited to attend a Specific Carbohydrate Diet Cooking class.
Learn and share recipes; Learn how to make cookies, breads, cakes, crackers, and more; Make things that are nutritious and delicious.
Presented by Pam Ferro RN and Julie Przybyszewski RN Date: June 11, 2004, 6-9pm Nemasket Group

link.title: Happy 2004! The first bit of news we'll share her...
Happy 2004! The first bit of news we'll share her...

entry.title: Happy 2004! The first bit of news we'll share her...

summary.div: Happy 2004! The first bit of news we'll share here: the Top 6 Most Frequently Accessed areas of SCDiet.org! Recipes About the SCD and SCDiet.org SCD FAQ (be sure to also visit Elaine's site, mentioned below) SCD friendly doctors Dry Curd Cottage Cheese (DCCC) sources Email and online Support Groups Stay tuned for new Success Stories as they are submitted to us!

entry.title: SCD and Autism With the advent of the new SCD rel...

summary.div: SCD and Autism With the advent of the new SCD related listserves, an email list focused on the SCD and Autism is growing and patients are doing well. More information is available in the Research section of this site.

link.title: BreakingTheViciousCycle.info has launched and is E...
BreakingTheViciousCycle.info has launched and is E...

entry.title: BreakingTheViciousCycle.info has launched and is E...

summary.div: BreakingTheViciousCycle.info has launched and is Elaine's personal web site, dedicated to information found in the book by the same title, by Elaine Gottschall. It provides information and guidance for those considering the SCD or beginning the diet, acts as a hub for all the support groups/ list serves that are true to SCD as described in Elaine's book, is an accessbile resource for all aspects

entry.title: CCFA prints SCD news article (pdf file)-- a reprin...

summary.div: CCFA prints SCD news article (pdf file)-- a reprint in the NE Chapter newsletter which originally appeared in the Los Angeles Chapter's newsletter. Note: proper instructions to join the SCD List are found in our Community section.

Thanks to everyone who submits news and updates vi...

entry.title: Thanks to everyone who submits news and updates vi...

summary.div: Thanks to everyone who submits news and updates via the Feedback link! Here are a few updates (more to come): 2003 Testimonials, SCD and autism, and the Websites page.

link.title: A special Valentine's Day story ...
A special Valentine's Day story ...

entry.title: A special Valentine's Day story ...

summary.div: A special Valentine's Day story Every February 14th we are reminded of the very special doctor, Dr. Sydney Valentine Haas. He was the doctor who saved Elaine and her daughter, and who created the SCD. Elaine went on to research this SCD, publishing her own books and now helping us each day

link.title: SCD in the Wall Street Journal: Wall Street Journ...
SCD in the Wall Street Journal: Wall Street Journ...

entry.title: SCD in the Wall Street Journal: Wall Street Journ...

summary.div:
SCD in the Wall Street Journal: Wall Street Journal, 11/11/2002 Health Supplement
Eating Is Believing: Patients suffering from Crohn's disease say diet can help their pain. This article, by Francesco Fiodella, describes how the SCD works, what the patients and the doctors think of it. It goes on to explain why the SCD isn't more widespread, saying, "The failure of the IBD diet to gain

link.title: The SCD Web Library (scdiet.org) was created in 19...
The SCD Web Library (scdiet.org) was created in 19...

entry.title: The SCD Web Library (scdiet.org) was created in 19...

summary.div: The SCD Web Library (scdiet.org) was created in 1995 by Mid Aidt. His goal was to archive meaningful debate and discussion related to the SCD and intestinal health through diet. We are now approaching 2003; there are many SCD-related lists and online groups now! Some of the best are self-archiving (what will they think of next?!). Today's update: updated list of online email and support

link.title: "Raw Life" author Paul Nison is touring the countr...
"Raw Life" author Paul Nison is touring the countr...

entry.title: "Raw Life" author Paul Nison is touring the countr...

summary.div: "Raw Life" author Paul Nison is touring the country to speak about his book, "Raw Knowledge". According to Paul's website, www.rawlife.com, he had ulcerative colitis and cured himself with raw foods. His diet does go quite against the SCD (especially the SCD's intro stages which prefer cooked foods) but his experience and perspective may be worthwhile for some. As you can see, diet *does* have

entry.title: "Most Popular Links" added! After reviewing the w...

summary.div: "Most Popular Links" added! After reviewing the web site statistics, we are providing links to the most popular pages in each directory. The 3-5 most popular links will be listed in the upper right of the homepage for each directory. So far we've updated the Recipes, Community, and FAQ sections. Stay tuned for the other sections! Audrey Kron, of "Ask Audrey", passed away on the 25th of

link.title: Raman, chief cook and bottlewasher at SCDRecipe.co...
Raman, chief cook and bottlewasher at SCDRecipe.co...

entry.title: Raman, chief cook and bottlewasher at SCDRecipe.co...

summary.div: Raman, chief cook and bottlewasher at SCDRecipe.com, has made his immense collection of SCD recipes available for download via PDF! If you don't have Adobe Acrobat Reader you can get it free at Adobe.com; or you can read the recipes one by one. Happy SCD cooking!

link.title: New Dutch research finds Rectal characteristics di...
New Dutch research finds Rectal characteristics di...

entry.title: New Dutch research finds Rectal characteristics di...

summary.div: New Dutch research finds Rectal characteristics differ in Irritable Bowel Syndrome subtypes. Either people get diarrhea or they get constipated, and there are rectal tones and sensitivities that go with each type of IBS.

summary.div:
Not All Carbohydrates Are Good A Harvard Medical School article explores the changes needed to improve the USDA's "food pyramid" for proper health; certain aspects of the article carry additional weight for those wishing to achieve intestinal health through diet:
